Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2009 01:32PM Magnola wrote: Lindatwo: I got rid of the hats last week.  I found myself pointing out the fact that I was hatless.  Tuesday night, we went to my daughter's open house at school and I told anyone and everyone that it was one of my first times with my security blanket, I mean black Nike baseball hat.  Then, on Wednesday night we went to my son's open house (he's at Jesuit High School) and again made comments.  I need to stop explaining myself and just be free.  I am right at 3 months PFC and have pretty good coverage. Chelev: your trip is coming right, right? You must be soo excited!

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2009 03:11PM Magnola wrote: I see white peach fuzz!!  Finally!  I'm so excited!!!

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2009 11:34AM Magnola wrote: I started with the Nioxin shampoo two days ago and now I have 5:00 shadow.  Might be that my hair was just ready to come in or it might be the shampoo gave me the boost the follicles need.  I don't care which it was, I am just so happy to see growth.  I am 7 weeks out tomorrow.  Also, had my exchange surgery on Tuesday.  Yippee!  No more rocks in my chest.  Recovery has been easy, just get jabs of pain every now and then.  Life is heading back to normal!  Lainey-I love your style and can't wait to get to that stage.  You're 17 weeks PFC, right?
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2009 03:38PM - edited Jul 14, 2009 03:39PM by Magnola Today, I had my preop for my exchange surgery scheduled for next Tuesday-Yippee!  The nurse said to discontinue using Biotin until after the surgery.  Anyone know why?  Is it a blood thinner? Still not even stubble for me-nothing is growing!  YUCK! I'm five weeks PFC on Thursday.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2009 04:05PM Magnola wrote: Chelev-I heard the same thing Dawn did about Rogaine-once you start, you can't stop or the new hair will fall out.  I am 8 weeks pfc-still wearing a baseball hat, but the hair is definitely trying to grow.  I went from white to black-definite 5:00 shadow on the doom!  I can't wail to get to Lisa's and Lainey's stage!  Patience, patience, patience... Getting my stitches out from my exchange surgery on Tuesday-I can't wait, because little pieces of the stitches are sticking out and catching on my shirts.  That little tug hurts!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2009 02:45PM Magnola wrote: Chelev:  How cool!!  Professional makeover would be awesome!  Be sure to take before and after pictures.  I'm loving your hair.  Are you wigless and hatless?  I'm at 10 weeks pfc and have begun taking the hat off.  We live in a marina neighborhood in Tampa and went "without" to a small gathering on the boats Saturday.  Still haven't been able to venture outside the community hatless, but it's coming. I was in the doc's office today and read an article that Sept. 8 is National Real Hair Day...never knew there was such a thing, but I think that's my cue to loss the hat forever.  3 weeks more growth should be just enough.  I'm circling 9/8 on my calendar! Susan, your hair is awesome.  That's the style I would like to get to and then keep it there! -Maggie
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2009 06:11PM Magnola wrote: Lisa:  How is Miracle?  I was reading your posts on the TCH site.  Were they able to remove the tumor? Donna:  You and I are on the same schedule.  4 weeks PFC tomorrow for me, too.  No growth yet...but I keep looking!  I actually kept about 30% of my hair.  It's thin and short, but sticks out under a hat.  I hope what I have doesn't hinder any new growth!  Keep me updated on your progress.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2009 04:46PM Magnola wrote: DonnaDio: you've got a lot of hair for just two months out!  I have a little less than you and I'm 11 weeks today and spend about 50% of my time "as is" (I like that term) and 50% in a baseball hat.  Sort of depends on where I'm going.  My family is supportive when I say I'm not wearing my hat...but tested my daughter the other morning when she said I'm fine without.  Then I told her that I would be popping by her school to drop something off.  How quickly her support wavered when she begged me to keep the hat on.  She's 10 and meant no harm, but she's my gauge for when I will be able to have a hat burning party! Thanks for the pictures!  It's fun to out a face to a name!
